name: nabeel84
text: Hilarious looking back on this post and seeing that it garnered lames because people don't know that back then you couldn't see the alt-text in AssetBar.

text: A chubby for your valiant effort

text: He bears an uncomfortable resemblance to a Hanna Barbera character when in mid-hiccup.

name: johnnyrocker
text: Hey-ey boob! (imagine i am talking like yogi bear here. this is key.)

name: hollygolightly
text: What Hanna Barbera character had a face that was constantly in the process of melting?

name: dipstikk
text: All of them, if by melting, you mean "suicide." Nobody wants to be a Hanna Barbera character.

name: snowman
text:
Aw, come on, now. Hanna Barbera characters are pretty awesome.

This strip is incredible, by the way. 5'd so hard.

text: nice try... Bensington Butters!

name: andyk
text: A comment left by andyk was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Bredtt, Pox, ButterMoths, hellofyellin, riotdejaneiro, snowman, mashisoyo, The_Dude, Howard, brzbee, fattypneumonia, Rocket6240, zaer, scraggg, HellaEdgar, campincarl)

name: satellitetv
text: You're right, White plays that shitty-ass airline.

name: kalethan
text: Have you actually played one of those airlines? They have incredible, fat, textured, beefy necks, and ridiculously rich, mid-rangey, quiet, low output humbuckers that combine to make Airline/Supro/et als sound better than almost any of the vintage guitars from that era. The bridges were pretty bad, the gears mediocre, but the guitars are among the best sounding of the pre-good-hardware era. Now, Rickenbackers are are some shitty, poorly intonated, thin-ass, too-treble-ey guitars. Thank you. It is now 4:39 in the afternoon, and I'm about to go to work. It has been one of those days

name: achilleselbow
text: There are exactly 8 White Stripes fans on this board, apparently.

name: achilleselbow
text: A comment left by achilleselbow was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by Bredtt, riotdejaneiro, The_Dude, campincarl)

name: i_love_kate
text: Not only that, but there's also apparently one person who considers the very act of not liking the White Stripes lame-worthy.

name: i_love_kate
text: Okay, two. Depressing stuff, Assetbar.

text:

name: rosie
text: Ray's hair is an awesome touch. Also, Beef is such a rad guy for taking care of his friends.

text: A comment left by untilyouaresonude was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by shammack, desdin0va, SoManyWhales)

name: eviltkat
text: To understand Jack White you must become Jack White. Not surprisingly, both require you to get hella slanted.

name: saint
text: A comment left by saint was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by worldbelow, atom, magnificentpoof, scraggg)

name: pogo
text: "Hella" appeared on South Park like a hella long time ago.

name: mattylite
text: Even real alive people have been saying hella for years.

name: johnnyrocker
text: Yeah man "hella" was the phrase back in my elementary school.

name: heccibiggs
text: There's a fucking No Doubt song called Hella Good. It's not that obscure of a phrase. I used it before reading Achewood (although my usage has significantly increased since).

name: heccibiggs
text: Coming across this comment a week later, it sounds really bitchy and angry. Wasn't intended that way. Sorry. Sorry, everyone.

name: tripleg
text: it's ok, you're still hella rad

name: johnnyrocker
text: HOW DARE YOU YOU ARE SO BITCHY

name: fineoakstructure
text:
heccibiggs is so bitchy. Did you see when she quit assetbar?

it is the gin in me talking heccibiggs, I do apologize

sorry apologise

name: shutup_shutup
text: This all reminds me of the aftermath of the aforementioned use of "hella" on South Park that caused a lot of people not from the Western US to believe that the word had been made up by Parker and Stone.  Oddly enough I had a similar experience, not with "hella," but with "queef."

name: greenkoolayd
text: for noveltys sake, i started using 'hell of', rather than 'hella'.  every now and again, anyway.

name: madrin
text: i remember laughing hysterically at this strip. what roast beef says in panel 4 is just perfect. when i'm drunk and jamming i pretty much always repeat the second panel.

name: jujubeesforjesus
text: I dont know which is more oft quoted by me and my cohorts  "The guitar sound got to be so nasty" or "There comes a time"  Total classic.

name: nutmeg
text: man he fell immediatly into those z's

name: aplomb
text: Beef seems to exhibit an inexplicable terror of Jack White imitations.

name: stuart
text: It's explicable, with Ray doubly so.

name: junko
text: This is a personal favorite

name: crinklebat
text: For some reason Ray in this strip reminds me of Peppermint Patty. There has to be some Peanuts from the 60s where her hair is all rumpled up like that and that's what I'm remembering.

name: sargasm
text: Jack White gets into the bed so hard it kills a man

name: tekende
text: I gave this a real chubby, but it's so funny I'm going to have to offer a virtual chub as well. Hats off to you.

name: aliiis
text: I also wish to offer a double-chub

name: randyjohnson
text: I once saw a man go to bed in reno just to watch... him... d-die

name: madrin
text: my friends got me a signed copy of this strip for my 21st due to my tendency to get wasted, spew out a couple of ray's lines and then play some seriously sloppy white stripes on guitar. this strip would have to be at least top 5. But, as you all know, it is impossible to narrow down that much.

name: heavymetaljesus
text: I love how Roast Beef is so worried about Ray impersonating Jack White like it's some sort of deadly sin.

name: pitseleh
text:
That's because it is, my friend.

That's because it is.

name: dayvancowboy
text: Even Jack White should avoid imitating Jack White.

name: hateandwar
text: Ray's bulge is present in his Jack White pants.

name: leftsaidtim
text: Jack White's bulge is present in Ray's pants.

name: drskradley
text: If I had to choose one, it'd be this.  There is no doubt.

name: ricnine
text:
Agreed in full. I'd give this 10/5 if I could.
Also, Notice that your avatar is awesome.
where'd you get it

name: drskradley
text: Uh...stole it from somewhere on Myspace, I think. It was a page devoted to all things horror with specific reference to Evil Dead, and I pilfered it with reckless abandon. You, too, may take it, for this is what the internet is all about, baby. I don't know the original, nor what it was called, so I guess you can't get the high quality version :( Unless I figure out Photobucket, which I can't be bothered doing right now. Sorry, friend. It's just the way it is.

name: falseprophet
text: Jack White would never answer to a name that is not Jack White. It's just not stripely.

name: pox
text:
Great strip, or greatest strip?

I'm leaning towards greatest.

name: xiaomimi
text:
Weekend Blogs

Philippe: Didn't write any more haikus...yet.

Today's Blogs

Little Nephew: curpeter

name: kalethan
text: I think Onstad really puts a lot into Li'l Nephew strips and blogs. He could just keep it at the BK chat room level and we'd eat it up with a spoon and clamor for more, but no, he has to go all Baby O'Riley and This Poem Deep... rarely has English this misspelled been so powerfully communicative..."Eat it? Dump it in thee water?" ... oh goody

name: daidai
text:
I wish I could say I was as awesome a friend as Beef in this situation.

But, as far as being a good friend is concerned, I've never been in a situation even approaching this one in terms of importance.

name: direhaggis
text: Friends don't let friends imitate Jack White.

name: cyberia
text: I am basically Roast Beef to my friend's Ray every time he gets drunk.

name: gopacapulco
text:
i am basically jack white to my friends

all the time

name: tekende
text:
Who likes to smoke?
Enjoys a joke?
And wouldn't get a bit
upset if he were really broke?
With wealth and fame
He's still the same
I'll bet you five you're not alive
If you don't now his name

name: jhunter
text: man this applies so perfectly to Ray and is also relevant such that I'd like to sprinkle you with hand-shredded chubbies

name: heccibiggs
text: Horrifying, psychopathic, misandric violence in the name of a good comment.

name: heccibiggs
text: (Also I just basically made up the word "misandric" apparently.)

name: i_love_kate
text: Misandristic, I would guess.

name: apricotta
text: The "heh", "whoah" and "hic" that are not pronounced but rather depict a state of mind do it for me.

name: apricotta
text: That state of mind being, of course, hella drunk.

name: atticusonline
text: it is silly to be jack white!

name: comrade_tom
text:
The "there comes a time" bit in this strip made me listen to Neil young as opposed to the white stripes or the raconteurs,

subliminal messaging?

name: oldhusky
text: every time i see or hear the phrase "there comes a time" it is in the voice of Sam Elliott

name: usversusthem
text: The line "Now why would you say a thing like that to Jack White" stands out to me as being one of Onstad's all-time greatest. Pure classic.

name: red-barchetta
text: You know your friends are too drunk when they are imitating Jack White.

name: inthewater
text: Only Ray could pull this off.

name: aperson
text: And even he didn't quite manage it.

name: mrectomy
text: "There comes a time" made me bust up. Just the implication that every man, at some point in his life, has to imitate Jack White. Like it's some kind of rite of passage.

name: heccibiggs
text: I don't see a strap. That guitar is glued to Ray's shirt.

name: unkle_bob
text: There is also no cord going from the guitar to the amp. This is what makes the guitar notes so ...nasty...

name: vermy
text: I salute Beef's Solution

name: dasilodavi
text: In media res.

name: cagliostro
text: ...you've lost me somewhere, I'm afraid.

name: dasilodavi
text:
Just commenting on the fact that the strip starts "in the middle of an encounter" with Roast Beef and Ray. No exposition, no alcoholic run up to this, no back story establishing why Ray feels the need to imitate Jack White.

My Latin is shitty, but I do believe [in media res] means "in the middle things.

name: cagliostro
text:
Oh! Well that's a totally relevant and legitimate comment, so I apologise for doubting you. Have a chubby.

(It is, technically, 'in medias res'. Just in case you're ever at a party with some Romans and want to look cool. It could happen.)

name: riotdejaneiro
text:
This is the strip that got me into Achewood.
I am getting into the bed because that is what Jack White does
Solid gold

name: capslock_annliv
text:
how the HELL did I miss this strip while going through the archives

jesus, five'd

name: icecube
text: Crooked glasses to indicate intoxication (clever touch), plus how the hell tight are his jeans. This strip single-handedly sets the course of Drunk/Sober relations back a decade by being so accurate .

name: greenkoolayd
text: someone please explain to me what is so bad about jack white...

name: icecube
text: My interpretation is that no badness is implied. It is just antics gone too far for Ray to be imitating him.

name: sevenslashfour
text:
This is so far my favorite strip, ever. In part because most of the comments on it are almost as hilarious as the strip itself, which alone nearly made me laugh so hard I blew snot out my nose.

It made me laugh so hard, that I almost snotted on my keyboard.

Not one of those long chuckles, of course. More like a "pffffffthahahaha" kinda thing. You know the one.

name: vulpes-aurum
text:
Your icon... it looks so familiar...

[IMGS OFF]

name: archimedes2000
text: Jack White is a good person who you should imitate.
